UNIVERSITY POLLUTION CONTROL OFFICE
OFFICE MEMORANDUM No. 3 s. 2021
TO : ALL UNITS, COLLEGES, and OFFICES
FROM : JUNSER P. MAGPANTAY UNIVERSITY POLLUTION CONTROL OFFICER
NOTED : CAMILO A. POLINGA Vice President for Administrative and Support Services
SUBJECT : HAZARDOUS WASTES GENERATION REPORTING AND DESIGNATION OF POLLUTION CONTROL COORDINATORS
DATE : June 07, 2021
Please be informed that the University Pollution Control Office is conducting quarterly monitoring of the University’s hazardous wastes that is reported to DENR-EMB IVA Regional Office. This monitoring includes all types of hazardous wastes specified under DAO No. 2013-22 (please see attached file).
In conducting the inventory, please take note of the following:
1. All hazardous wastes from different colleges/units/offices should be properly classified according to type.
2. All solid hazardous wastes must be in kilograms kg for solid wastes, and in Liters (L) for liquid wastes. No hazardous wastes shall be reported per piece.
3. All empty ink bottles/ink cartridges, batteries should not be disposed together with the waste delivered at the MRF for these are considered as hazardous wastes.

4. For electrical wastes that are hazardous, all must be categorized and weigh according to its type. If wastes will be condemned to Supply Office, the inventory will be conducted by the last office that will be handling the wastes.
5. All colleges/units/ offices must designate their temporary hazardous wastes storage. Each waste much be properly labeled using the prescribed yellow sticker.
6. Each college/unit/office shall recommend to the University PCO their respective identified Pollution Control Coordinator (PCC) where the responsibilities are as follows:
i. The designated PCC will be in-charge in submitting a quarterly report on the inventory of hazardous wastes generated by their respective college/unit/office to the University PCO.
ii. Attend meeting/seminar/training/workshop regarding the National, Provincial, Municipal, and University’s environmental policies and relay it to their respective college/unit/office.
iii. Monitor solid waste management within their respective college/unit/office.
iv. Report environmental incidents to University PCO.
7. For the college/unit/office who has hazardous wastes generation for this quarter, kindly send your inventory on or before June 15, 2021 to PCO email address or visit our temporary office located in Room 301 Agricultural Science Building, CAFENR.
8. For strict compliance.
9. Thank you for your cooperation.
